pr_title: HDDS-4559. Avoid using hard coding uft-8 charset

timeline.message: HDDS-4559. Avoid using hard coding uft-8 charset

timeline.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText: I think keep GDPR_CHARSET here is better, because define constants about GDPR here.
replies.author: lamberken

timeline.bodyText:
This is used in two kinds of calls:

RandomStringUtils.random: its chars parameter is not intended for charsets, rather the set of characters to use.  Eg. for "UTF-8" it will generate strings like "--8F8T8U8T".  Since we don't need this special kind of random string, this usage can be simply removed.
IOUtils.toInputStream: can accept Charset, too.

After removing the first kind of usage, we can convert this constant to Charset.  (I would also inline it, ie. simply use UTF_8.)
timeline.author: adoroszlai

timeline.bodyText: Nit: this constant can be replaced with import static java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets.UTF_8;.
timeline.author: adoroszlai

timeline.bodyText: Nit: usages of this constant can be replaced with the one from StandardCharsets.
